solution_line_template: He makes it in batches of {batch_gallons}*{ounces_per_gallon}=<<{batch_gallons}*{ounces_per_gallon}={batch_ounces}>>{batch_ounces} ounces
He drinks {ounces_every_two_days}/{days_for_consumption}=<<{ounces_every_two_days}/{days_for_consumption}={ounces_per_day}>>{ounces_per_day} ounces of coffee a day
So he drinks the coffee in {batch_ounces}/{ounces_per_day}=<<{batch_ounces}/{ounces_per_day}={days_to_drink_batch}>>{days_to_drink_batch} days
So in {total_days} days he makes {total_days}/{days_to_drink_batch}=<<{total_days}/{days_to_drink_batch}={num_batches}>>{num_batches} batches
That means he spends {num_batches}*{hours_per_batch}=<<{num_batches}*{hours_per_batch}={total_hours_making_coffee}>>{total_hours_making_coffee} hours making coffee
